quotes.speaker: Erik ten Hag
quotes.quote_raw: He is a real frontman. Very direct to the goal, very good presser, a physical presence.
quotes.quote_summary: Hojlund is a strong, direct forward who excels in pressing.

quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
quotes.quote_raw: He is extremely satisfied at Sporting, he is very focused on the club and the objectives for this season, which include winning the national title and improving.
quotes.quote_summary: He is happy at Sporting and focused on winning this season's objectives.

quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
quotes.quote_raw: He knows that Sporting is the ideal club for this evolution.
quotes.quote_summary: Sporting is the perfect club for his development.

quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
quotes.quote_raw: Sporting is Diomande’s present and future and it is where he wants to evolve.
quotes.quote_summary: Diomande sees Sporting as his current and future path for growth.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: He can play in several positions, he has a lot of quality and irreverence. He is another option.
quotes.quote_summary: Quenda is versatile and has exceptional quality.

quotes.speaker: Roberto Martinez
quotes.quote_raw: The national team coaches always say that age is not a factor. (Quenda) showed incredible personality, quality and adaptability.
quotes.quote_summary: Age doesn't matter in football; Quenda displays great personality and adaptability.

quotes.speaker: Roberto Martinez
quotes.quote_raw: He’s a player who likes to make things difficult (for defenders). He has technical quality (that is) not normal for a 17-year-old. He’s now in Sporting’s first team and has shown incredible personality.
quotes.quote_summary: Quenda presents unique challenges for defenders and exhibits remarkable technical skills for his age.

quotes.speaker: Sverre Nypan
quotes.quote_raw: It would be 'a dream come true' to feature for the Red Devils, having been made aware of their interest.
quotes.quote_summary: Playing for Manchester United would be a dream come true for me.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw: Goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale (finger) and defender Jan Bednarek (knee) will miss Sunday's game and be out for "a number of weeks". Alex McCarthy will deputise for Ramsdale and Martin has "so much trust" in him to perform.
quotes.quote_summary: Ramsdale and Bednarek are out for weeks; we trust McCarthy to perform.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw: The aim when he came in last year in the Championship - and he was disappointed not to be in the Premier League at that point - was to get there together and give him the best chance of achieving his dream of international football.
quotes.quote_summary: We aimed to support his journey to international football after he joined us last year.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw:
It's happened - it is what it is. 
Howard Webb accepted a lot of our points and we had to accept a lot of his, because it's not easy. But I think it was important for us to have a chat.
quotes.quote_summary: After discussing with Howard Webb, we had to accept some points; it was important to communicate.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw: We showed the guys the table how it looked at this point last season, and how much it changed by the end of December. It's such an exciting month.
quotes.quote_summary: We showed the squad last season's table to highlight how much can change in December; it's an exciting time.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw: Teams have shown in recent weeks that you can pick up big results against big teams and good opposition.
quotes.quote_summary: Recent teams have proven you can achieve big results against strong opponents.

quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
quotes.quote_raw: Liverpool are "the best team in the country at the moment on current form" and on Arne Slot's start as boss, he added: "When you go into a club that's built on something for so long with top players that have bought into that, he hasn't changed too much. It's the best management at that point to continue some of the brilliant things they were good at, and put his own spin on it, which he has done."
quotes.quote_summary: Liverpool are currently the best team; Slot's management respects the club's heritage while adding his touch.

quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
quotes.quote_raw: I'm not too bad at changing focus. People have asked me about it at home and England is not something I want to talk about too much now. We've got a job to do in the league. Me scoring for England has not hidden the fact that we're bottom of the league and we've got a big game on Sunday against Liverpool.
quotes.quote_summary: I can shift my focus; my England goal doesn't change the fact we're at the bottom of the league with an important game ahead.

quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
quotes.quote_raw: They give me a bit of stick whenever I mention it - they set me up and then when I start, they hammer me for mentioning it.
quotes.quote_summary: My teammates tease me whenever I bring up my England achievement.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: I think part of that Matt is simply because they are prepared to spend more money, have ambitious owners, and are further along the journey than Saints. Back in the summer Saints had a certain wage structure they wanted to live by and adhere to, and of course some players and their agents will want more and will go elsewhere.
quotes.quote_summary: Clubs like Brighton have invested more, while Saints stuck to a wage structure which limited recruitment options.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: I think Sport Republic’s long-term ambitions are to create a business model that is self-sufficient in the long-term, and can produce talent that can add value to the teams they own, but also add asset value and create profit for reinvestment and sustainability by developing talent.
quotes.quote_summary: Sport Republic aims to build a self-sufficient club that harnesses youthful talent for sustainability.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: Do I think it’s viable to change manager? The answer is yes if you’re an owner and you’re 100% sure you are getting an upgrade. I've outlined the risks of doing it in this thread too, but me personally? I think the squad are playing for the manager and I’d rather gamble on spending money on a striker that can make a difference in January, as a preference to ripping everything up and starting again.
quotes.quote_summary: Changing managers is viable only if confident in an upgrade; I prefer to invest in a striker instead of starting over.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: My honest answer Chris is that I don’t know and neither does anyone else. It could be strongly argued that you may get a cliched new-manager-bounce if that were to happen, but it’s just too simplistic and short-term.
quotes.quote_summary: It's uncertain if a new manager would help; a short-term boost is possible but ideal long-term strategy is vital.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: What I do think is that he needs to come up with solutions to help the team and not sacrifice that help for his own ends. Let’s be honest, we all forget that no manager’s reputation is enhanced by losing.
quotes.quote_summary: He must prioritize team solutions over personal philosophy; losing doesn't help anyone's reputation.

quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
quotes.quote_raw: Totally agree John. I was gutted Saints messed that up to be honest. You’re right, he’s never been prolific, but he was absolutely a focal point for the team in possession, and better than anyone else in the current squad at holding the ball up, showing for it, and at playing round the corner to be used as a pivot to start attacks.
quotes.quote_summary: I agree, Saints failed to replace a key player whose presence helped link the team's play.

quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
quotes.quote_raw: It is every young kid's dream to make their debut for England, but to get a goal was magical. I was given a few hints on Saturday that I would be needed at some point so I was just getting myself ready for that, but you also don’t believe it until it happens. When I got the nod to come on, I was over the moon.
quotes.quote_summary: Scoring on my England debut was magical; I prepared but didn't fully believe until I was called to play.

quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
quotes.quote_raw: Playing for my country at every level is something I take great pride in. To play for the seniors is what dreams are made of. It is the pinnacle of football.
quotes.quote_summary: I take pride in representing my country; playing for the seniors is a dream and the pinnacle of football.

quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
quotes.quote_raw: A sense of unity will always give you a chance, especially when people are all pulling in the same direction. At times you can fall out of form but that's when you really see what the clubs are like.
quotes.quote_summary: Unity gives a team a chance, showing true character during tough times.

quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
quotes.quote_raw: I don't think the team and staff are being delusional. Sometimes you just need belief because you know you have the quality and that might have come from their first win of the season over Southampton.
quotes.quote_summary: The team is not delusional; belief in their quality is vital after a win.

quotes.speaker: Mike Taylor
quotes.quote_raw: I understand the crowd. But we know our manager.
quotes.quote_summary: The players have faith in their manager despite the crowd's feelings.

quotes.speaker: Mario Lemina
quotes.quote_raw: We know our manager is doing everything. Sometimes it's not about him - it's just about what we do on the pitch. Today showed he was a good tactical manager.
quotes.quote_summary: Our manager is doing his best, and today's game demonstrated his tactics effectively.

quotes.speaker: Mario Lemina
quotes.quote_raw: We have to stick together. The whole city has to stick together, the club need to stick together, and that’s what we did.
quotes.quote_summary: Unity is essential; the entire community and club must come together.

quotes.speaker: Matheus Cunha
quotes.quote_raw: If you put that performance against a Manchester City or a Liverpool, you'd say it was a tactical masterclass... But all that mattered on Saturday was Wolves getting the win.
quotes.quote_summary: Against top teams, it could have been seen as tactical brilliance, but the win was all that counted this time.

quotes.speaker: Matheus Cunha
quotes.quote_raw: We are very lucky to have a player of his quality. He's a bit of a maverick.
quotes.quote_summary: Having a player of his caliber is a great advantage for us.

quotes.speaker: Micah Richards
quotes.quote_raw: His football IQ is absolutely sensational. He's the one who can unlock the doors. He finds the little pockets of space and makes the right decisions at the right times.
quotes.quote_summary: His exceptional intelligence on the field helps unlock opportunities for the team.

quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
quotes.quote_raw: It depends on how those two games go. Results obviously matter but so do the manner of performances.
quotes.quote_summary: The outcome and performance of the next two games are crucial.

quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
quotes.quote_raw: I wouldn't say these next two games are defining as to whether he keeps his job, but the club know they have to start performing better and soon.
quotes.quote_summary: The upcoming matches aren't decisive for the manager's future, but results need to improve quickly.

quotes.speaker: Lee Carsley
quotes.quote_raw: I made Marc captain when he was in the under-21s. He is a player who shows leadership qualities in his career so far not only off the pitch but on the pitch.
quotes.quote_summary: Marc Guehi was a captain and exhibits strong leadership both on and off the field.

quotes.speaker: Lee Carsley
quotes.quote_raw: He’s had a really good camp and is playing really well for Palace. There’s a lot more to come from him. He’s fast and aggressive.
quotes.quote_summary: Marc Guehi has been performing well and has great potential ahead.

quotes.speaker: Fara Williams
quotes.quote_raw: I kind of get it from both points of view but, as a player, if I am half fit and being played by my club, I would be fully available for my national team.
quotes.quote_summary: I understand both sides, but I would choose to represent my country even if not fully fit.

quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
quotes.quote_raw: They've got a really good manager in Oliver [Glasner],
quotes.quote_summary: Oliver Glasner is a strong manager for the team.

quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
quotes.quote_raw: The home form at Palace always gets them over the line. They always manage to get results against the big sides and it's the sides who are in and around the same position as Palace they'll be looking to try and get the results against.
quotes.quote_summary: Palace's home form traditionally secures results, especially against similar-level teams.

quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
quotes.quote_raw: The injuries aren't great for Palace at the minute, but they've still got a really good squad.
quotes.quote_summary: Despite injuries, Palace has a strong squad.

quotes.speaker: RedBird representatives
quotes.quote_raw: Oggi Pulisic è insostituibile e anche incedibile, ma sappiamo come la politica dei fondi di investimento, e RedBird non fa eccezione, sia quella di monetizzare di fronte ad offerte importantissime.
quotes.quote_summary: Pulisic is currently irreplaceable, but investment policies require us to monetize significant offers.

quotes.speaker: Unnamed analyst
quotes.quote_raw: Sicuramente il valore è cresciuto incredibilmente ed è tornato ad avvicinarsi alla valutazione che ne fece il Chelsea, oltre 60 milioni, quando lo acquistò dal Borussia Dortmund.
quotes.quote_summary: His value has grown significantly, nearing the 60 million valuation from Chelsea when he was bought from Dortmund.

quotes.speaker: Unnamed commentator
quotes.quote_raw: Un discorso diverso, invece, lo può fare il calciatore dato che 4 milioni di euro è una cifra incredibilmente alla portata di molti top club, soprattutto in Premier League.
quotes.quote_summary: With a salary of 4 million euros, Pulisic is affordable for many top clubs, especially in the Premier League.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: I want us to play without fear from day one and to win time and patience through victories and establishing a clear identity and idea that the fans can recognise and get behind.
quotes.quote_summary: We will play fearlessly and build a clear identity for the fans to support.

quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
quotes.quote_raw: He is the key to the success of the past two seasons and getting him to sign a new deal was the most important event in our summer. We get nervous every time a Premier League club sacks their manager. He is brilliant.
quotes.quote_summary: Kieran McKenna's signing was crucial for our recent success; his potential departure worries us as he is exceptional.

quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
quotes.quote_raw: Confidence is high after the past two performances. I am slightly wary of calling a win, as you assume the United players will want to impress their new boss. I think as it is at Portman Road we can get a point, but we expect United to be up for it and to present a huge challenge.
quotes.quote_summary: We're confident after recent performances, but a win feels uncertain due to United's desire to impress their new manager; a draw seems likely.

quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
quotes.quote_raw: Hopeful rather than confident. We seem to be finding our feet, as the win at Spurs shows, but the odds are against us as a team that was in League One in recent memory. We will fight to the end and will not be daunted by any challenge, and McKenna's ability to improve players and maintain team spirit will be key.
quotes.quote_summary: We're cautiously optimistic about avoiding relegation; recent performances give hope, but past struggles make it tough.

quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
quotes.quote_raw: Amorim will be tasked with delivering on several fronts, but United fans are desperate to see an attractive playing style that showcases a sense of identity. We did not know which United would show up from one week to another under Erik ten Hag, and he lost his job for not winning enough football matches.
quotes.quote_summary: With Amorim, we expect an attractive playing style to rebuild identity, especially after inconsistency under Ten Hag.

quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
quotes.quote_raw: The biggest issue in my eyes was how Ten Hag came from a successful Ajax side that played great football, and when he was unable to implement that system at United, he tried to make us a transitional team heavily reliant on the counter-attack. The Dutchman may be a shrewd tactician but he watched his midfield regularly get overrun.
quotes.quote_summary: Ten Hag failed to bring his successful Ajax style to United, opting for a counter-attack that left our midfield exposed.

quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
quotes.quote_raw: No, because I enjoy reminiscing about those times. The Class of '92 is not something any other English club has been able to replicate and can only be compared to the Busby Babes of the 1950s and 1960s. Our academy still produces the best young players in the country, as seen with Alejandro Garnacho and Kobbie Mainoo.
quotes.quote_summary: I prefer to reminisce about the past; no team has matched the Class of '92, and our academy continues to produce exceptional talent.

quotes.speaker: Mark Ashton
quotes.quote_raw: A local man, global superstar, sponsor of the football club, now a shareholder and now officially part of our recruitment team. In the summer we were trying to persuade one particular player to join the football club and realised very quickly that he was an Ed Sheeran fan. Ed jumped on a Zoom call with him at the training ground just before he stepped on stage with Taylor Swift, hopefully that was a key part of getting the player across the line. We've gone from the third tier of English football to the Premier League, but we haven't forgotten our roots and Ed's a key part of that. The work that we do in our local communities is central to us.
quotes.quote_summary: Ed Sheeran, as a shareholder and recruitment team member, helped us attract a player, emphasizing our commitment to our roots despite Premier League success.

quotes.speaker: Ben Johnson
quotes.quote_raw: I didn't realise how difficult it would be to settle in. I thought I would just come in and hit the ground running, but that's life if it doesn't happen like that. I feel like I've come in for the last few games and taken my opportunity. I've come in and the rhythm and form has picked up. I feel like I am fully settled now. It's just about wanting to come here and be committed to this club. I really see a vision and see great things from the players and the staff. It's something I want to be a part of, just giving my all and playing for the team is important to me.
quotes.quote_summary: Settling in has been tougher than expected, but I've adapted well recently and am committed to contributing fully to the team and its vision.

quotes.speaker: Ben Johnson
quotes.quote_raw: It's going to be a great game, probably one of the most televised games this season because it's massive when United come to town. Their new manager is very good and is going to implement a lot of great stuff. We're playing at Portman Road. It can be intimidating at times but it's a great stadium and we love to play there. It's going to be a great game regardless of what happens. It's always a great feeling when you play against the biggest clubs in the world.
quotes.quote_summary: The match against United will be significant and exciting; Portman Road is intimidating yet we enjoy playing there.

quotes.speaker: George Burley
quotes.quote_raw: It's one step at a time, but at the moment I’m feeling well. Their performances have been excellent. It's about making good performances and I haven't been panicking because the team have been playing really well and there's improvement every week. I've got every confidence that we get to stay in the Premier League this season.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm feeling well amidst treatment; I'm confident about Ipswich's good performances and continuous improvement leading to Premier League survival.

quotes.speaker: Fara Williams
quotes.quote_raw: I kind of get it from both points of view but, as a player, if I am half fit and being played by my club, I would be fully available for my national team.
quotes.quote_summary: I understand both sides, but if I'm fit enough to play at the club level, I would also want to represent my national team.

quotes.speaker: Aaron Ramsey
quotes.quote_raw: They were a breath of fresh air really, to do back-to-back promotions. Everyone was saying the wheels were going to fall off at some point, but they were just relentless. I love the belief they have in their squad. They scored so many late goals in that season last year and even when they were 2-0 or 2-1 down, they managed to get a result or go on and win the game, which is so important to have that sort of mentality.
quotes.quote_summary: Ipswich's back-to-back promotions showed their relentless nature; they consistently believed in their squad's ability to come back and win games.

quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
quotes.quote_raw: That's part of their maturity in this division because a lot of these players are doing it for the first time. We're seeing players like Liam Delap get headlines for the goals he's scoring - and they should be spoken about - but if they want to stay up, it's got to be about the collective.
quotes.quote_summary: Ipswich's maturity is evident as many players are learning to adapt in this division; it’s crucial for their survival to focus on teamwork, not just individual performances.

quotes.speaker: Samuel Luckhurst
quotes.quote_raw: Sources say United have been following Quenda's progress since the start of the season and he is under contract at Sporting until 2027.
quotes.quote_summary: United have tracked Quenda's progress and he is signed until 2027.

quotes.speaker: Alphonso Davies' agent
quotes.quote_raw: Reports of a deal between my client and Real Madrid are 'not true' and he has options, including staying at Bayern.
quotes.quote_summary: Davies' agent denied any agreement with Real Madrid, stating he may stay at Bayern.

quotes.speaker: Rene Meulensteen
quotes.quote_raw: Ruben Amorim’s arrival is a pivotal moment in the Manchester United career of Marcus Rashford. The new manager will bring fresh ideas and a new motivation which Rashford needs to use to rediscover his best form because he hasn’t been enjoying his football. His body language under Erik ten Hag was not of a player who enjoyed playing and those were not good signs, he needs to buy into the new system because if he doesn’t he will be moved on by Amorim. It’s up to both the player and the manager but predominantly Rashford, he’s on huge money but sometimes that isn’t enough motivation. When I was working at United, the big intrinsic motivation was one, to play for Manchester United and number two, to be successful at Manchester United. It was all about winning. It's all about winning games, all about winning trophies and that motivation, it comes from within. That is already a coping mechanism to deal with when things are not going that well. Rashford isn’t a young player anymore and he has to live up to expectations and find that desire and passion to play for United again, or he’ll have a problem and might be looking for a new club.
quotes.quote_summary: Rashford's career hinges on Amorim's arrival, as he needs to find motivation to improve or risk being moved on.

quotes.speaker: Paul Merson
quotes.quote_raw: Marcus Rashford was clearly not the first-choice in attack under Ruud van Nistelrooy. So he has to turn things around under Amorim. If he is unable to do that, I think United have a big problem. Rashford's wages are going to become an issue if they want to move him on. I don't know who buys him at the moment. It will be interesting to see how he performs under Amorim, certainly something to keep an eye on.
quotes.quote_summary: Rashford must improve under Amorim or United will face significant challenges, especially regarding his high wages.

quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
quotes.quote_raw: I’ve been really impressed with what the manager has said so far. He certainly has charisma, a personality, he’s laughing and joking with questions. He got asked the question, ‘If I’m a Manchester United fan, what can I see on day one?’ And more often than not a manager would bat that question away and say, ‘Oh, hang on, I’ve only had two training sessions, we’ve got a long way to go, there’s a lot to change.’ But he’s just said straightaway, ‘I can guarantee you that you will see a plan, you’ll see an idea in the first two or three games.' I’m not a Manchester United fan, obviously, but if I’m a Manchester United fan that would fill me with confidence that he was so confident in his abilities, his system.
quotes.quote_summary: Amorim's confidence and clear plan for his early games should reassure Manchester United fans.

quotes.speaker: Fabrizio Romano
quotes.quote_raw: As I told you, there is still no agreement done with any club. Real Madrid remain there. But for Alphonso Davies, there are several possibilities. So let’s see what’s going to happen. On Manchester United, a name I already told you last year, because Manchester United were monitoring this player, and keep monitoring this player.
quotes.quote_summary: There is no agreement for Davies yet; United continues to monitor his situation closely.

quotes.speaker: Tiago Teixeira
quotes.quote_raw: We are prepared to welcome him today to train for the first time and we are very happy to have him here. He is also very happy with the season he is having representing Sporting and his national team. He is very happy to be here. What we want is to have him for as long as possible.
quotes.quote_summary: Gyokeres is content with his current form and wants to stay at Sporting for now.

quotes.speaker: Viktor Gyokeres
quotes.quote_raw: These are rumours, nothing concrete. Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I enjoy my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes. He [Amorim] probably already has strikers there. It's very sad that he left [Sporting], but of course, we understand the decision. He meant a lot to me, as he gave me an opportunity and helped me evolve a lot.
quotes.quote_summary: While aware of transfer rumors, Gyokeres is committed to finishing the season at Sporting and values Amorim's impact on his career.

quotes.speaker: Leroy Sane
quotes.quote_raw: I have confidence in myself, in the situation and also in my club. We are in a transparent and relaxed exchange. I will definitely not sign for another club on January 1 or 2. I don’t need a quick decision. I have a sympathy for the Premier League, I still watch certain games on TV. The attraction for me lies in the club where I can show my best performance, develop and win titles. I have that at Bayern. This is where I have my greatest challenge and goals.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm focused on Bayern for now and not making immediate plans for a Premier League move, although I still watch the league.

quotes.speaker: Randal Kolo Muani
quotes.quote_raw: You have to keep your mental strength up, it's up to me to continue working so that the coach trusts me.
quotes.quote_summary: I need to maintain my mental resilience and work hard for the coach's trust.

quotes.speaker: Randal Kolo Muani
quotes.quote_raw: It's part of my history. I've always worked, I've never had things easy.
quotes.quote_summary: I've always had to work hard and face challenges.

quotes.speaker: Randal Kolo Muani
quotes.quote_raw: I have to work harder, make an impression when he calls on me. It's up to me to give my all so that he trusts me.
quotes.quote_summary: It's my responsibility to work harder and prove myself to earn the coach's trust.

quotes.speaker: Luke Humphries
quotes.quote_raw: Had a great time filming on the [@wearetheoverlap] today with some of the best footballers to have played the game.
quotes.quote_summary: I enjoyed filming with top footballers today.

quotes.speaker: Luke Humphries
quotes.quote_raw: Was a great laugh and enjoyed the experience.
quotes.quote_summary: It was a fun experience.

quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
quotes.quote_raw: (While discussing the sport's challenge) It's all about practice. We could all become darts players if we practiced.
quotes.quote_summary: Darts success comes from practice; anyone can succeed with enough effort.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: It's magnificent is the darts.
quotes.quote_summary: Darts is magnificent.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: (Recalling a memorable match) It is a bit rowdy but to watch that... Like remember last year when they were both on for the nine darter! Watching that in the moment, it was watching perfection. Two guys at the very highest level, the peak of their performance, one of the most exciting things I've ever seen.
quotes.quote_summary: Darts can be chaotic, but witnessing top players perform at their peak is incredibly exciting.

quotes.speaker: Gary Neville
quotes.quote_raw: Roy 'the Killer' Keane.
quotes.quote_summary: Neville suggested a nickname for Keane.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: Roy 'the Grumbler' Keane.
quotes.quote_summary: Wright suggested another nickname for Keane.

quotes.speaker: Junior Pedroso
quotes.quote_raw: Yes, this story has a basis in truth. No (negotiations stopped as), Salah renewed his contract at the time with Liverpool, and that made Antony's move to Liverpool impossible.
quotes.quote_summary: There was genuine interest in Antony, but Salah's contract renewal made the transfer impossible.

quotes.speaker: Erik ten Hag
quotes.quote_raw: Dear fans, Let me start by thanking you. Thank you for always being there for the club. Whether it was at a game far away or a tough match at Old Trafford, your support has been unshakeable. The atmosphere at Old Trafford has always been electrifying, thanks to you. I felt it many times. Also in away games, it gave the team and me an incredible feeling to hear the United chants taking over the opponents stadiums, whether the game was in England. Europe or during the summer tours. I always enjoyed meeting Manchester United fans throughout the world. Walking the streets and being able to chat with fans in England, Europe, Asia, Australia, the USA - you inspired me and radiated a strong sense of unity. That's what makes United supporters so special. I want to thank you for giving me this feeling and for your support. I also want to thank the staff in every department of the club for their unwavering support in good times and bad. We won two trophies - achievements that I will cherish for the rest of my life. Of course, my dream was to bring more trophies to the cabinet. Unfortunately, that dream has come to an end. I wish all Manchester United fans nothing but success, trophies and glory. Your support and the warmth I received from everyone at the club helped me feel at home. Thank you for this chapter in my life.
quotes.quote_summary: I thank the fans for their unwavering support and share my regrets for not winning more trophies during my time at United.

quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes
quotes.quote_raw: I have played, however, especially last season with coach Ten Hag, deeper. In fact, against Everton, I played No.6 and I still think it was one of the most complete games I've played, at all levels. In terms of passing, game organisation, defence, tactics. I have a little thought in my head that I'm going to end my career further back, because everyone who started there and went to No.10 ended up retreating on the field at the end. It's a position I like, playing deeper, facing the game more. With the ball, it makes my game a lot easier because I have a broader view of the game and it is ideal for what we've talked about with the last pass, which can sometimes come from deeper on the pitch. The game with Everton was the one in which I created the most scoring opportunities, even though I was playing deeper and not playing as a No.10.
quotes.quote_summary: I have experience playing deeper, and I envision ending my career in a similar role as it allows me to have a broader view of the game and create opportunities, as I did against Everton.

quotes.speaker: John Murtough
quotes.quote_raw: Antony is one of the most exciting young talents in European football and has exactly the right profile for the attacking, dynamic team that Erik ten Hag is building.
quotes.quote_summary: Antony is a promising young talent fitting for ten Hag's dynamic team.

quotes.speaker: Antony
quotes.quote_raw: I definitely need more goal participations and to score more goals. It's something I demand from myself. Rest assured, you'll hear the name Antony in relation to goals and assists.
quotes.quote_summary: I must participate more in goals and I expect to be associated with goals and assists.

quotes.speaker: Antony
quotes.quote_raw: A lot happened last season. I played full back and was a little uneasy about it but that was because with the team losing or drawing you want to be in the attack to turn things around and help the team, so being moved into defence bothered me a bit, you feel annoyed in the moment during the game, but afterwards it's all fine.
quotes.quote_summary: Last season was tough; moving to full-back was frustrating but I learned to accept it.

quotes.speaker: Antony
quotes.quote_raw: I would show them 'his notes one day.'
quotes.quote_summary: I intend to share my notes someday.

quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
quotes.quote_raw: I’ve been really impressed with what the manager has said so far.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm impressed with the manager's statements so far.

quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
quotes.quote_raw: I can guarantee you that you will see a plan, you’ll see an idea in the first two or three games.
quotes.quote_summary: He assures fans they'll notice a plan in the initial games.

quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
quotes.quote_raw: Let’s not forget, the Premier League has the best managers in the world and he’s coming up against some top operators.
quotes.quote_summary: The Premier League has top managers, posing a challenge for him.

quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
quotes.quote_raw: I admired how confident [Amorim] was and this real belief he seems to have...
quotes.quote_summary: I admired his confidence and belief.

quotes.speaker: Pep Guardiola
quotes.quote_raw: (On his future regardless of the charges) At the moment we are innocent until it is proved we are guilty I know the people want it. I know, I feel it. I will wait. Wait and see it and after the sentence has been done we will come here and explain it. But absolutely I will not consider my future (if) it depends being here or being in League One. Absolutely. There is more chance to stay if we are in League One than if we were in the Champions League.
quotes.quote_summary: I will wait for the verdict; my future is not dependent on whether we're in League One or the Champions League.

quotes.speaker: Pep Guardiola
quotes.quote_raw: Manchester City means so much to me. This is my ninth season here; we have experienced so many amazing times together. I have a really special feeling for this football club. That is why I am so happy to be staying for another two more seasons. Thank you to everyone for continuing to trust and support me, it has always been an honour, a pleasure and a privilege to be here. Hopefully now we can add more trophies to the ones we have already won. That will be my focus.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm thrilled to stay at City; it's been an incredible journey and my focus is on adding more trophies.

quotes.speaker: Fabrizio Romano
quotes.quote_raw: The club is already assessing options with more than three candidates in list. It only remains to be seen whether it’s gonna happen in January or summer window (most likely).
quotes.quote_summary: United is evaluating options with multiple candidates, likely for January or summer.

quotes.speaker: Fabrizio Romano
quotes.quote_raw: Left back is a priority position. In 2025, Man Utd want to sign an important left-back. Amorim wants a top left-footed player in that position. Let me say clearly today that Manchester United are working on a new, important left-back or left-wing back. For sure United will do something there.
quotes.quote_summary: Left back is a priority, and Amorim desires a skilled left-footed player for 2025. United is actively pursuing this signing.

quotes.speaker: Fabrizio Romano
quotes.quote_raw: They are monitoring Kerkez, even before Amorim. Liverpool are also monitoring him and Richard Hughes, Liverpool director, knows him so well from his time at Bournemouth. It’s not only Kerkez or Davies, there are also other names they are monitoring.
quotes.quote_summary: Both United and Liverpool are tracking Kerkez, with several other players also being considered.

quotes.speaker: Andy Goldstein
quotes.quote_raw: I've heard a whisper. I've heard they're going to be found not guilty of all of them.
quotes.quote_summary: I've heard they might be found not guilty of all charges.

quotes.speaker: Andy Goldstein
quotes.quote_raw: It's just a whisper, it's unconfirmed. It's some bloke down the pub telling me, that sort of level.
quotes.quote_summary: It's unconfirmed and just a rumor from a casual source.

quotes.speaker: Andy Goldstein
quotes.quote_raw: Listen, it's just a whisper. I was the first person to say Declan Rice is going to Arsenal. There's footage of me saying that from around a year before it happened, from a reliable source.
quotes.quote_summary: I previously predicted Declan Rice's move to Arsenal based on a reliable source, but this is just a whisper.

quotes.speaker: Erling Haaland
quotes.quote_raw: I hope Pep signs a new contract. He has been important for me in the first two-and-a-half years.
quotes.quote_summary: I want Pep to sign a new contract because he has been crucial for my development.

quotes.speaker: Erling Haaland
quotes.quote_raw: I hope he stays longer. I like Pep a lot and hope he likes me, too.
quotes.quote_summary: I wish Pep stays with the team longer, and I appreciate him.

quotes.speaker: Florentino Perez
quotes.quote_raw: The possibility of joining Real Madrid, a club with such a rich legacy and boundless ambition, is tempting for any footballer.
quotes.quote_summary: Joining Real Madrid is appealing for players due to its legacy and ambition.

quotes.speaker: Kolo Muani
quotes.quote_raw: No, I've never thought about it.
quotes.quote_summary: I've never considered leaving.

quotes.speaker: Kolo Muani
quotes.quote_raw: You have to keep the mentality. It's up to me to keep working so that the coach trusts me. That's part of my story. I've always had to work hard, things have never been easy for me. You can't let up. If you let up, it's over, then you'll go under.
quotes.quote_summary: I need to maintain my mentality and work hard for the coach's trust; that's my journey.

quotes.speaker: Gary Neville
quotes.quote_raw: The professionalism, looking after your body and making sure you’re best prepared for the next training session is critical to every decision you make during the season.
quotes.quote_summary: Professionalism and body care are crucial for preparing for training sessions throughout the season.

quotes.speaker: Gary Neville
quotes.quote_raw: He [Marcus Rashford] has got a mental break, he’s got to get away and has got to rest with friends - then you talk about the choice of venue, how far do you fly, what’s the time difference, is that going to give a jet lag issue, is that going to give a stiffness issue from being on a flight for 12 hours?
quotes.quote_summary: Rashford deserves a mental break, but travel choices raise concerns about jet lag and stiffness.

quotes.speaker: Gary Neville
quotes.quote_raw: If you are talking about the minor details in being as professional as you can be and as prepared you can be for a training session on a Monday night, that isn’t the best choice of venue.
quotes.quote_summary: For optimal professionalism and preparation for training, choosing the venue was not ideal.

quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
quotes.quote_raw: For [Marcus] Rashford and all these lads, going to the United States and going on private jets, whatever they are doing – like basketball, that’s the norm for them. We’re sitting there and going, ‘all the way to the States?’ They [players] would think the States is no big deal.
quotes.quote_summary: For the players, traveling to the U.S. is normal and not a big concern.

quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
quotes.quote_raw: If they were sitting here, they would say, ‘What are you talking about? This is my life and it’s what I do.'
quotes.quote_summary: The players would see their travel as a routine part of their lifestyle.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: If it’s my time off then yes, I’d do it. Simply, because it’s my time off. If you’re going for three or four days, that jetlag won’t cause you too much of a problem.
quotes.quote_summary: I'd travel during my time off as it won't significantly affect me if it's only a few days.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: Casemiro and Marcus Rashford are taking a chance that this [travelling 12 hours to the United States for four days] is going to be criticised if they don’t play well - they are accepting what’s to come.
quotes.quote_summary: Rashford and Casemiro risk criticism for their travels if they don’t perform well afterwards.

quotes.speaker: Ian Wright
quotes.quote_raw: If he [Rashford] doesn’t do well in his first game, and in the next two or three games he scores - nobody cares.
quotes.quote_summary: Rashford's early performance will be scrutinized, but later successes might overshadow initial failures.

quotes.speaker: Pedro Porro
quotes.quote_raw: He is young, has a lot of ambition, a little bit like [Ange Postecoglou] here at [Tottenham]. He always wants more and that’s what puts him on the world’s lips and coveted by so many teams in Europe,
quotes.quote_summary: Amorim is ambitious and desires more, making him highly regarded in Europe.

quotes.speaker: Pedro Porro
quotes.quote_raw: He has a special way of working. He plays eye to eye against any opponent, which is also similar to what we do at Tottenham, there are several similarities. It is known and recognised how Sporting and Tottenham play. There is a clear identity, whether winning 5-0 or losing 5-0.
quotes.quote_summary: Amorim has a unique working style and a strong identity in how teams play, similar to Tottenham's approach.

quotes.speaker: Nedal Huoseh
quotes.quote_raw: Done deal with Real Madrid? This is NOT true. Though the player has many options, we have not agreed terms with any club. [Regarding Davies' potential transfers] A new deal at FC Bayern could also be an option. Any reports suggesting otherwise are incorrect.
quotes.quote_summary: There is no deal with Real Madrid for Davies; we haven't agreed with any club and a new contract with Bayern is possible.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: We know that we need time, but we have to win time. To win time is to win games. But the most important thing for me is identity. So, from day one, we will start with our identity. The most important thing for me at this moment is to create the principles, the identity and the character that we had in the past.
quotes.quote_summary: We must win games to gain time but establishing our identity is crucial from the start.

quotes.speaker: Roy Keane
quotes.quote_raw: Well, I didn’t choose it [the number], no. When I went to [Manchester] United, my squad number was 16…just my training number. Then when the number come in, and I just said, ‘I’ll stay [with] my squad number.' And the manager [Sir Alex Ferguson], when Eric [Cantona] left, he said, ‘I want you to have the number seven,' I said, ‘No, No…give it to Becks [David Beckham].' And Ferguson went, ‘I don’t f*****g want him to have it.'
quotes.quote_summary: I didn't choose number 16; it was my training number at United. Ferguson wanted me to have number seven, but I insisted it go to Beckham instead.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: It has been an incredibly hard and difficult time for myself and my family.
quotes.quote_summary: This period has been challenging for my family and me.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: My only focus has been on our children and building my brand Preppy.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm concentrating on our children and my brand, Preppy.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: Now I just want to move forward.
quotes.quote_summary: I want to make progress now.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: Naturally this has been hard for me but my only concern has been our children and that will not change.
quotes.quote_summary: This has been tough for me, but my priority remains our children.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: I have been working on this brand for three years and it is something I am incredibly proud of.
quotes.quote_summary: I've dedicated three years to this brand and I'm proud of it.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: Jermaine is excited for the business and what it holds for me in the future.
quotes.quote_summary: Jermaine is enthusiastic about my business's future.

quotes.speaker: Ellie Penfold
quotes.quote_raw: He has been supportive of me in this respect and as a working mum.
quotes.quote_summary: He supports me as a working mom.

quotes.speaker: Jermaine Jenas
quotes.quote_raw: I was in shock at the time, there was a lot to process. But I’m the married one, I’m at fault.
quotes.quote_summary: I felt overwhelmed and acknowledge my responsibility.

quotes.speaker: Jermaine Jenas
quotes.quote_raw: The overriding panic by a mile was that I could lose my family.
quotes.quote_summary: My biggest fear was losing my family.

quotes.speaker: Jermaine Jenas
quotes.quote_raw: There’s something in me that’s praying there is some level of mercy or understanding of the fact we’re human beings and we all make mistakes, some bigger than others and mine is a big mistake.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm hoping for understanding as we all make mistakes, and mine was significant.

quotes.speaker: Jermaine Jenas
quotes.quote_raw: Ellie is absolutely raging. She’s human.
quotes.quote_summary: Elly is understandably upset.

quotes.speaker: Jermaine Jenas
quotes.quote_raw: When I see her now, she is just making sure the children are okay.
quotes.quote_summary: She's focused on ensuring the children are alright.

quotes.speaker: Fan
quotes.quote_raw: If he goes, he goes, [it] won't go down well with LFC fans if he walks away for nothing. I’ve seen us lose better players going back to Rush leaving for Juventus. We've always kicked on.
quotes.quote_summary: Losing him for free would upset LFC fans, but we've bounced back from worse losses.

quotes.speaker: Fan
quotes.quote_raw: It's obvious he's going, what I'm interested in is when he's gonna announce it. And what impact it has on our run-in, given that it won't go down well and the Klopp announcement last season derailed us.
quotes.quote_summary: It's clear he's leaving; I'm curious about the announcement timing and its impact on the season.

quotes.speaker: Fan
quotes.quote_raw: It's just advertising for a brand that has nothing to do with football... Move on.
quotes.quote_summary: It's merely sponsorship, unrelated to football; time to move on.

quotes.speaker: Bryan Mbeumo
quotes.quote_raw: I have spent five years at Brentford, at a club that has allowed me to grow and pass a milestone, but yes, I would like to play in the biggest competitions, at the best clubs.
quotes.quote_summary: After five years at Brentford, I want to play in top competitions for the best clubs.

quotes.speaker: Bryan Mbeumo
quotes.quote_raw: It is tantalising to see some big clubs interested in me. We will see [about a transfer].
quotes.quote_summary: It's exciting to be wanted by big clubs; I'll consider a transfer.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: I had an agreement with my mother. I would continue at school until I signed a professional contract. I signed when I was 17. Today, I regret it a lot. If I’d taken my exams, I could have done the 12th year. I could also have entered a top college. My wife is an electrotechnical engineer and she throws that in my face every day.
quotes.quote_summary: I agreed to stay in school until I signed a contract, which I did at 17, and now I regret not finishing my exams and education, as my wife often reminds me of her qualifications.

quotes.speaker: Charlotte Harpur
quotes.quote_raw: It's his charisma, it's his smile. It's very easy to say, but when you interact with him, just from a media perspective, it's fresh and it is different, especially in contrast to Erik ten Hag. I think you can always get a bit carried away. They say it's the hope that kills you, but from the impression that I've had, speaking to his family and to his friends, even in his recent and quite short experience as a coach, they feel he is different and can offer a fresh look. It's hard to express, they said. He's going to provide Manchester United, hopefully, with a clean page and a new perspective.
quotes.quote_summary: His charisma and smile make interactions refreshing and different compared to Erik ten Hag, suggesting he brings a new perspective to Manchester United.

quotes.speaker: Arne Slot
quotes.quote_raw: We expect him back after the break. The first weeks after the break, I always say there is privacy about the injury. He will be back one or two weeks after the break.
quotes.quote_summary: We anticipate his return shortly after the break, but respect privacy around the injury's details.

quotes.speaker: Steven Railston
quotes.quote_raw: So what you might be wondering, could Ennis be pushing to make his first-team debut? The answer is he should be.
quotes.quote_summary: Ennis should be pushing for a first-team debut.

quotes.speaker: Steven Railston
quotes.quote_raw: Whether Ennis is given an opportunity to play for the first-team remains to be seen, but he can't do much more in academy games and seems guaranteed to enjoy a fulfilling career.
quotes.quote_summary: Ennis deserves a chance in the first team but has excelled in the academy.

quotes.speaker: MEN
quotes.quote_raw: He will continue to be an integral U21 player and could be allowed to leave on a temporary deal to challenge himself in a senior environment in the January window.
quotes.quote_summary: He'll remain key for U21s but may go on loan in January to gain senior experience.

quotes.speaker: Sheyi Ojo
quotes.quote_raw: It’s funny because everywhere I go people ask me about it but honestly I haven’t got a clue who it is. All I can say is I’m super focused on football as I always have been, that’s pretty much the only thing that matters to me. I wouldn’t be putting anything else in the picture to sway my concentration, it’s definitely not something I’m involved in but I understand everyone’s curiosities.
quotes.quote_summary: I have no idea who Dide is; I’m focused on football and not involved in it.

quotes.speaker: Amadou Onana
quotes.quote_raw: There has been some rumours but there is a player code that I can't break. People try to get it out of my mouth but I won't.
quotes.quote_summary: I can't disclose Dide's identity due to a player code, despite the rumors.

quotes.speaker: Viktor Gyokeres
quotes.quote_raw: Thanks for yesterday.
quotes.quote_summary: Grateful for the previous match's support.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: So, from day one, we will start with our identity.
quotes.quote_summary: We will begin establishing our identity immediately.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: The most important thing for me at this moment is to create the principles, the identity and the character that we had in the past.
quotes.quote_summary: Creating principles, identity, and character from the past is my top priority.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: If you work as a team, then the talent individually is going to shine.
quotes.quote_summary: Teamwork enables individual talent to stand out.

quotes.speaker: Rebekah Vardy
quotes.quote_raw: That feeling when you are living rent free in people's heads [laughing emojis].
quotes.quote_summary: I'm amused that I'm occupying people's thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Rebekah Vardy
quotes.quote_raw: Everyone thinks Jamie is mad at me for speaking out, but that couldn’t be further from the truth. He’s encouraging me, saying, ‘Give it to her, get the truth out there’. He loves it that she’s back getting headlines. The more stick he gets from the stands in football, the better he plays.
quotes.quote_summary: Jamie isn't upset by my comments; rather, he supports me speaking out and feels it boosts his performance.

quotes.speaker: Rebekah Vardy
quotes.quote_raw: she always wanted my life
quotes.quote_summary: Coleen has always aspired to live my lifestyle.

quotes.speaker: Marcel Reif
quotes.quote_raw: It’s no secret that he will probably move to Liverpool next summer. I would put a few euros on it. As the successor to his great idol Mo Salah. Things couldn’t get any better for him.
quotes.quote_summary: It's expected he will likely join Liverpool next summer as Salah's successor.

quotes.speaker: Markus Krosche
quotes.quote_raw: That [amount] won't be enough. It's often the case with many players who join us that we provide them with an environment where they can continue to develop—fully aware that we would let them go if they develop faster than the club itself. That's an agreement we make with the players.
quotes.quote_summary: The quoted amount is insufficient; we help players develop but will let them go if they exceed the club's growth.

quotes.speaker: Bade
quotes.quote_raw: it is reported that Sevilla would ‘accept’ a fee of around €30m (£25m) according to Spanish outlet todofichajes.
quotes.quote_summary: Sevilla would accept approximately €30m for Bade's transfer.

quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
quotes.quote_raw: Manchester United have a new manager, Paul Pogba needs a new club and anything can happen in football
quotes.quote_summary: With a new manager at United, Pogba could find a new club since anything is possible in football.

quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
quotes.quote_raw: Paul is desperate to get back playing and if there was a transfer fee you couldn't see it, but as a free agent it's a different ball game completely.
quotes.quote_summary: Pogba is eager to return to play, and being a free agent changes the situation significantly compared to having a transfer fee.

quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
quotes.quote_raw: There will be money involved but it could be relatively risk-free and he'll be desperate to impress.
quotes.quote_summary: Though there will be expenses, signing Pogba could be a low-risk decision, as he will be keen to prove himself.

quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
quotes.quote_raw: My time at Juventus has come to an end. It has been a privilege to pull on the shirt of the bianconeri and to share so many special moments together. I cherish the moments we made. They live on
quotes.quote_summary: I’ve concluded my time with Juventus, cherishing the special memories we created together.

quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
quotes.quote_raw: I would say Dele (Alli),
quotes.quote_summary: Dele Alli was my toughest opponent in training.

quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
quotes.quote_raw: My first few camps, when I was younger, and he was at the top of his game at that time.
quotes.quote_summary: When I was younger, Dele was at his peak during our training camps.

quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
quotes.quote_raw: He was untouchable.
quotes.quote_summary: He was unbeatable in training.

quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
quotes.quote_raw: I spoke about it in my interview and don't want to go over it too much again – but I know my level as a player and what I can get to.
quotes.quote_summary: I recognize my own level as a player and my potential.

quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
quotes.quote_raw: It's hard for me to even watch football. It's been tough for me, I'd say, this past eight months has been hard to watch.
quotes.quote_summary: It's been difficult for me to follow football due to my situation over the past eight months.

quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
quotes.quote_raw: You know you can set reminders on your phone, I have a reminder at 11 o'clock every day that says, 'World Cup 2026.' That's my aim for now.
quotes.quote_summary: I have a daily reminder for 'World Cup 2026' as my current goal.

quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
quotes.quote_raw: I think that people will be like, 'he hasn't played in a year,' but I don't care, I know my level.
quotes.quote_summary: Despite not playing for a year, I am confident in my abilities.

quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: We know that we need time, but we have to win time. To win time is to win games. But the most important thing for me is identity. So since day one we will start with our identity.
quotes.quote_summary: We need time to succeed, but we have to win games to create our identity immediately.

quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: That’s for sure. That’s why we are Manchester United. That’s why we are … a long time ago, we don’t win the Premier League. But if you ask, Manchester United is the biggest club in England. So this is part of the history, it is not now. So we have to address that, to show that and to try to win again.
quotes.quote_summary: Manchester United's history is significant, and we need to acknowledge it while striving to win again.

quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: When Manchester United talked to me, Omar, they told me about their plans and you get excited. It’s a real honour because I was the first choice to start that path. So it’s a great responsibility. But you feel honoured and excited to be part of that.
quotes.quote_summary: I'm honored to be the first choice and excited about Manchester United's plans.

quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
quotes.quote_raw: It’s hard to explain. It’s strange because it’s a feeling of belonging at the first day. And I know that it’s going to be tough. I know it’s a massive challenge, but I feel quite relaxed. I feel at home and I think that is important in the beginning. So, I’m very excited.
quotes.quote_summary: I feel a strong sense of belonging in Manchester despite the challenges ahead; I'm excited and relaxed.

quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy
quotes.quote_raw: To everyone at Manchester United Football Club, in particular the ­backroom staff, the players and the fans, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your incredible efforts and support. It has been a privilege and honour to ­represent the club as a player, coach and manager, and I will always cherish the memories we have shared together. @ManUtd will always have a special place in my heart, and I hope there are many more glory days at Old Trafford very soon – not only because I want the club to do well, but because you all deserve it!
quotes.quote_summary: I’m grateful for the support from everyone at Manchester United; it's been a privilege to be part of the club, and I hope for future success.

final_quotes.speaker: Erik ten Hag
final_quotes.quote_raw: He is a real frontman. Very direct to the goal, very good presser, a physical presence.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Hojlund is a strong, direct forward who excels in pressing.

final_quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
final_quotes.quote_raw: He is extremely satisfied at Sporting, he is very focused on the club and the objectives for this season, which include winning the national title and improving.
final_quotes.quote_summary: He is happy at Sporting and focused on winning this season's objectives.

final_quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
final_quotes.quote_raw: He knows that Sporting is the ideal club for this evolution.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Sporting is the perfect club for his development.

final_quotes.speaker: Luis Cassaiano Neves
final_quotes.quote_raw: Sporting is Diomande’s present and future and it is where he wants to evolve.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Diomande sees Sporting as his current and future path for growth.

final_quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: He can play in several positions, he has a lot of quality and irreverence. He is another option.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Quenda is versatile and has exceptional quality.

final_quotes.speaker: Roberto Martinez
final_quotes.quote_raw: The national team coaches always say that age is not a factor. (Quenda) showed incredible personality, quality and adaptability.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Age doesn't matter in football; Quenda displays great personality and adaptability.

final_quotes.speaker: Roberto Martinez
final_quotes.quote_raw: He’s a player who likes to make things difficult (for defenders). He has technical quality (that is) not normal for a 17-year-old. He’s now in Sporting’s first team and has shown incredible personality.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Quenda presents unique challenges for defenders and exhibits remarkable technical skills for his age.

final_quotes.speaker: Sverre Nypan
final_quotes.quote_raw: It would be 'a dream come true' to feature for the Red Devils, having been made aware of their interest.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Playing for Manchester United would be a dream come true for me.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw: Goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale (finger) and defender Jan Bednarek (knee) will miss Sunday's game and be out for "a number of weeks". Alex McCarthy will deputise for Ramsdale and Martin has "so much trust" in him to perform.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Ramsdale and Bednarek are out for weeks; we trust McCarthy to perform.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw: The aim when he came in last year in the Championship - and he was disappointed not to be in the Premier League at that point - was to get there together and give him the best chance of achieving his dream of international football.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We aimed to support his journey to international football after he joined us last year.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw:
It's happened - it is what it is. 
Howard Webb accepted a lot of our points and we had to accept a lot of his, because it's not easy. But I think it was important for us to have a chat.
final_quotes.quote_summary: After discussing with Howard Webb, we had to accept some points; it was important to communicate.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw: We showed the guys the table how it looked at this point last season, and how much it changed by the end of December. It's such an exciting month.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We showed the squad last season's table to highlight how much can change in December; it's an exciting time.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw: Teams have shown in recent weeks that you can pick up big results against big teams and good opposition.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Recent teams have proven you can achieve big results against strong opponents.

final_quotes.speaker: Russell Martin
final_quotes.quote_raw: Liverpool are "the best team in the country at the moment on current form" and on Arne Slot's start as boss, he added: "When you go into a club that's built on something for so long with top players that have bought into that, he hasn't changed too much. It's the best management at that point to continue some of the brilliant things they were good at, and put his own spin on it, which he has done.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Liverpool are currently the best team; Slot's management respects the club's heritage while adding his touch.

final_quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
final_quotes.quote_raw: I'm not too bad at changing focus. People have asked me about it at home and England is not something I want to talk about too much now. We've got a job to do in the league. Me scoring for England has not hidden the fact that we're bottom of the league and we've got a big game on Sunday against Liverpool.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I can shift my focus; my England goal doesn't change the fact we're at the bottom of the league with an important game ahead.

final_quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
final_quotes.quote_raw: They give me a bit of stick whenever I mention it - they set me up and then when I start, they hammer me for mentioning it.
final_quotes.quote_summary: My teammates tease me whenever I bring up my England achievement.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: I think part of that Matt is simply because they are prepared to spend more money, have ambitious owners, and are further along the journey than Saints. Back in the summer Saints had a certain wage structure they wanted to live by and adhere to, and of course some players and their agents will want more and will go elsewhere.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Clubs like Brighton have invested more, while Saints stuck to a wage structure which limited recruitment options.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: I think Sport Republic’s long-term ambitions are to create a business model that is self-sufficient in the long-term, and can produce talent that can add value to the teams they own, but also add asset value and create profit for reinvestment and sustainability by developing talent.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Sport Republic aims to build a self-sufficient club that harnesses youthful talent for sustainability.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: Do I think it’s viable to change manager? The answer is yes if you’re an owner and you’re 100% sure you are getting an upgrade. I've outlined the risks of doing it in this thread too, but me personally? I think the squad are playing for the manager and I’d rather gamble on spending money on a striker that can make a difference in January, as a preference to ripping everything up and starting again.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Changing managers is viable only if confident in an upgrade; I prefer to invest in a striker instead of starting over.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: My honest answer Chris is that I don’t know and neither does anyone else. It could be strongly argued that you may get a cliched new-manager-bounce if that were to happen, but it’s just too simplistic and short-term.
final_quotes.quote_summary: It's uncertain if a new manager would help; a short-term boost is possible but ideal long-term strategy is vital.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: What I do think is that he needs to come up with solutions to help the team and not sacrifice that help for his own ends. Let’s be honest, we all forget that no manager’s reputation is enhanced by losing.
final_quotes.quote_summary: He must prioritize team solutions over personal philosophy; losing doesn't help anyone's reputation.

final_quotes.speaker: Adam Blackmore
final_quotes.quote_raw: Totally agree John. I was gutted Saints messed that up to be honest. You’re right, he’s never been prolific, but he was absolutely a focal point for the team in possession, and better than anyone else in the current squad at holding the ball up, showing for it, and at playing round the corner to be used as a pivot to start attacks.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I agree, Saints failed to replace a key player whose presence helped link the team's play.

final_quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
final_quotes.quote_raw: It is every young kid's dream to make their debut for England, but to get a goal was magical. I was given a few hints on Saturday that I would be needed at some point so I was just getting myself ready for that, but you also don’t believe it until it happens. When I got the nod to come on, I was over the moon.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Scoring on my England debut was magical; I prepared but didn't fully believe until I was called to play.

final_quotes.speaker: Taylor Harwood-Bellis
final_quotes.quote_raw: Playing for my country at every level is something I take great pride in. To play for the seniors is what dreams are made of. It is the pinnacle of football.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I take pride in representing my country; playing for the seniors is a dream and the pinnacle of football.

final_quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
final_quotes.quote_raw: A sense of unity will always give you a chance, especially when people are all pulling in the same direction. At times you can fall out of form but that's when you really see what the clubs are like.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Unity gives a team a chance, showing true character during tough times.

final_quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
final_quotes.quote_raw: I don't think the team and staff are being delusional. Sometimes you just need belief because you know you have the quality and that might have come from their first win of the season over Southampton.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The team is not delusional; belief in their quality is vital after a win.

final_quotes.speaker: Mike Taylor
final_quotes.quote_raw: I understand the crowd. But we know our manager.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The players have faith in their manager despite the crowd's feelings.

final_quotes.speaker: Mario Lemina
final_quotes.quote_raw: We know our manager is doing everything. Sometimes it's not about him - it's just about what we do on the pitch. Today showed he was a good tactical manager.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Our manager is doing his best, and today's game demonstrated his tactics effectively.

final_quotes.speaker: Mario Lemina
final_quotes.quote_raw: We have to stick together. The whole city has to stick together, the club need to stick together, and that’s what we did.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Unity is essential; the entire community and club must come together.

final_quotes.speaker: Matheus Cunha
final_quotes.quote_raw: If you put that performance against a Manchester City or a Liverpool, you'd say it was a tactical masterclass... But all that mattered on Saturday was Wolves getting the win.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Against top teams, it could have been seen as tactical brilliance, but the win was all that counted this time.

final_quotes.speaker: Matheus Cunha
final_quotes.quote_raw: We are very lucky to have a player of his quality. He's a bit of a maverick.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Having a player of his caliber is a great advantage for us.

final_quotes.speaker: Micah Richards
final_quotes.quote_raw: His football IQ is absolutely sensational. He's the one who can unlock the doors. He finds the little pockets of space and makes the right decisions at the right times.
final_quotes.quote_summary: His exceptional intelligence on the field helps unlock opportunities for the team.

final_quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
final_quotes.quote_raw: It depends on how those two games go. Results obviously matter but so do the manner of performances.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The outcome and performance of the next two games are crucial.

final_quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
final_quotes.quote_raw: I wouldn't say these next two games are defining as to whether he keeps his job, but the club know they have to start performing better and soon.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The upcoming matches aren't decisive for the manager's future, but results need to improve quickly.

final_quotes.speaker: Lee Carsley
final_quotes.quote_raw: I made Marc captain when he was in the under-21s. He is a player who shows leadership qualities in his career so far not only off the pitch but on the pitch.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Marc Guehi was a captain and exhibits strong leadership both on and off the field.

final_quotes.speaker: Lee Carsley
final_quotes.quote_raw: He’s had a really good camp and is playing really well for Palace. There’s a lot more to come from him. He’s fast and aggressive.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Marc Guehi has been performing well and has great potential ahead.

final_quotes.speaker: Fara Williams
final_quotes.quote_raw: I kind of get it from both points of view but, as a player, if I am half fit and being played by my club, I would be fully available for my national team.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I understand both sides, but I would choose to represent my country even if not fully fit.

final_quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
final_quotes.quote_raw: They've got a really good manager in Oliver [Glasner],
final_quotes.quote_summary: Oliver Glasner is a strong manager for the team.

final_quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
final_quotes.quote_raw: The home form at Palace always gets them over the line. They always manage to get results against the big sides and it's the sides who are in and around the same position as Palace they'll be looking to try and get the results against.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Palace's home form traditionally secures results, especially against similar-level teams.

final_quotes.speaker: Martin Kelly
final_quotes.quote_raw: The injuries aren't great for Palace at the minute, but they've still got a really good squad.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Despite injuries, Palace has a strong squad.

final_quotes.speaker: RedBird representatives
final_quotes.quote_raw: Oggi Pulisic è insostituibile e anche incedibile, ma sappiamo come la politica dei fondi di investimento, e RedBird non fa eccezione, sia quella di monetizzare di fronte ad offerte importantissime.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Pulisic is currently irreplaceable, but investment policies require us to monetize significant offers.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Speaker is a representative of a company and not a named individual.

final_quotes.speaker: Unnamed analyst
final_quotes.quote_raw: Sicuramente il valore è cresciuto incredibilmente ed è tornato ad avvicinarsi alla valutazione che ne fece il Chelsea, oltre 60 milioni, quando lo acquistò dal Borussia Dortmund.
final_quotes.quote_summary: His value has grown significantly, nearing the 60 million valuation from Chelsea when he was bought from Dortmund.

final_quotes.speaker: Unnamed commentator
final_quotes.quote_raw: Un discorso diverso, invece, lo può fare il calciatore dato che 4 milioni di euro è una cifra incredibilmente alla portata di molti top club, soprattutto in Premier League.
final_quotes.quote_summary: With a salary of 4 million euros, Pulisic is affordable for many top clubs, especially in the Premier League.
final_quotes.invalid_reason: Speaker is unnamed and therefore not a valid speaker.

final_quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: I want us to play without fear from day one and to win time and patience through victories and establishing a clear identity and idea that the fans can recognise and get behind.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We will play fearlessly and build a clear identity for the fans to support.

final_quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
final_quotes.quote_raw: He is the key to the success of the past two seasons and getting him to sign a new deal was the most important event in our summer. We get nervous every time a Premier League club sacks their manager. He is brilliant.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Kieran McKenna's signing was crucial for our recent success; his potential departure worries us as he is exceptional.

final_quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
final_quotes.quote_raw: Confidence is high after the past two performances. I am slightly wary of calling a win, as you assume the United players will want to impress their new boss. I think as it is at Portman Road we can get a point, but we expect United to be up for it and to present a huge challenge.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We're confident after recent performances, but a win feels uncertain due to United's desire to impress their new manager; a draw seems likely.

final_quotes.speaker: Steve Mellen
final_quotes.quote_raw: Hopeful rather than confident. We seem to be finding our feet, as the win at Spurs shows, but the odds are against us as a team that was in League One in recent memory. We will fight to the end and will not be daunted by any challenge, and McKenna's ability to improve players and maintain team spirit will be key.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We're cautiously optimistic about avoiding relegation; recent performances give hope, but past struggles make it tough.

final_quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
final_quotes.quote_raw: Amorim will be tasked with delivering on several fronts, but United fans are desperate to see an attractive playing style that showcases a sense of identity. We did not know which United would show up from one week to another under Erik ten Hag, and he lost his job for not winning enough football matches.
final_quotes.quote_summary: With Amorim, we expect an attractive playing style to rebuild identity, especially after inconsistency under Ten Hag.

final_quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
final_quotes.quote_raw: The biggest issue in my eyes was how Ten Hag came from a successful Ajax side that played great football, and when he was unable to implement that system at United, he tried to make us a transitional team heavily reliant on the counter-attack. The Dutchman may be a shrewd tactician but he watched his midfield regularly get overrun.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Ten Hag failed to bring his successful Ajax style to United, opting for a counter-attack that left our midfield exposed.

final_quotes.speaker: Dale O'Donnell
final_quotes.quote_raw: No, because I enjoy reminiscing about those times. The Class of '92 is not something any other English club has been able to replicate and can only be compared to the Busby Babes of the 1950s and 1960s. Our academy still produces the best young players in the country, as seen with Alejandro Garnacho and Kobbie Mainoo.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I prefer to reminisce about the past; no team has matched the Class of '92, and our academy continues to produce exceptional talent.

final_quotes.speaker: Mark Ashton
final_quotes.quote_raw: A local man, global superstar, sponsor of the football club, now a shareholder and now officially part of our recruitment team. In the summer we were trying to persuade one particular player to join the football club and realised very quickly that he was an Ed Sheeran fan. Ed jumped on a Zoom call with him at the training ground just before he stepped on stage with Taylor Swift, hopefully that was a key part of getting the player across the line. We've gone from the third tier of English football to the Premier League, but we haven't forgotten our roots and Ed's a key part of that. The work that we do in our local communities is central to us.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Ed Sheeran, as a shareholder and recruitment team member, helped us attract a player, emphasizing our commitment to our roots despite Premier League success.

final_quotes.speaker: Ben Johnson
final_quotes.quote_raw: I didn't realise how difficult it would be to settle in. I thought I would just come in and hit the ground running, but that's life if it doesn't happen like that.
