I feel like I've come in for the last few games and taken my opportunity. I've come in and the rhythm and form has picked up. I feel like I am fully settled now. It's just about wanting to come here and be committed to this club. I really see a vision and see great things from the players and the staff. It's something I want to be a part of, just giving my all and playing for the team is important to me.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Settling in has been tougher than expected, but I've adapted well recently and am committed to contributing fully to the team and its vision.

final_quotes.speaker: Ben Johnson
final_quotes.quote_raw: It's going to be a great game, probably one of the most televised games this season because it's massive when United come to town. Their new manager is very good and is going to implement a lot of great stuff. We're playing at Portman Road. It can be intimidating at times but it's a great stadium and we love to play there. It's going to be a great game regardless of what happens. It's always a great feeling when you play against the biggest clubs in the world.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The match against United will be significant and exciting; Portman Road is intimidating yet we enjoy playing there.

final_quotes.speaker: George Burley
final_quotes.quote_raw: It's one step at a time, but at the moment I’m feeling well. Their performances have been excellent. It's about making good performances and I haven't been panicking because the team have been playing really well and there's improvement every week. I've got every confidence that we get to stay in the Premier League this season.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I'm feeling well amidst treatment; I'm confident about Ipswich's good performances and continuous improvement leading to Premier League survival.

final_quotes.speaker: Fara Williams
final_quotes.quote_raw: I kind of get it from both points of view but, as a player, if I am half fit and being played by my club, I would be fully available for my national team.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I understand both sides, but if I'm fit enough to play at the club level, I would also want to represent my national team.

final_quotes.speaker: Aaron Ramsey
final_quotes.quote_raw: They were a breath of fresh air really, to do back-to-back promotions. Everyone was saying the wheels were going to fall off at some point, but they were just relentless. I love the belief they have in their squad. They scored so many late goals in that season last year and even when they were 2-0 or 2-1 down, they managed to get a result or go on and win the game, which is so important to have that sort of mentality.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Ipswich's back-to-back promotions showed their relentless nature; they consistently believed in their squad's ability to come back and win games.

final_quotes.speaker: Nedum Onuoha
final_quotes.quote_raw: That's part of their maturity in this division because a lot of these players are doing it for the first time. We're seeing players like Liam Delap get headlines for the goals he's scoring - and they should be spoken about - but if they want to stay up, it's got to be about the collective.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Ipswich's maturity is evident as many players are learning to adapt in this division; it’s crucial for their survival to focus on teamwork, not just individual performances.

final_quotes.speaker: Samuel Luckhurst
final_quotes.quote_raw: Sources say United have been following Quenda's progress since the start of the season and he is under contract at Sporting until 2027.
final_quotes.quote_summary: United have tracked Quenda's progress and he is signed until 2027.

final_quotes.speaker: Alphonso Davies' agent
final_quotes.quote_raw: Reports of a deal between my client and Real Madrid are 'not true' and he has options, including staying at Bayern.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Davies' agent denied any agreement with Real Madrid, stating he may stay at Bayern.

final_quotes.speaker: Rene Meulensteen
final_quotes.quote_raw: Ruben Amorim’s arrival is a pivotal moment in the Manchester United career of Marcus Rashford. The new manager will bring fresh ideas and a new motivation which Rashford needs to use to rediscover his best form because he hasn’t been enjoying his football. His body language under Erik ten Hag was not of a player who enjoyed playing and those were not good signs, he needs to buy into the new system because if he doesn’t he will be moved on by Amorim. It’s up to both the player and the manager but predominantly Rashford, he’s on huge money but sometimes that isn’t enough motivation. When I was working at United, the big intrinsic motivation was one, to play for Manchester United and number two, to be successful at Manchester United. It was all about winning. It's all about winning games, all about winning trophies and that motivation, it comes from within. That is already a coping mechanism to deal with when things are not going that well. Rashford isn’t a young player anymore and he has to live up to expectations and find that desire and passion to play for United again, or he’ll have a problem and might be looking for a new club.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Rashford's career hinges on Amorim's arrival, as he needs to find motivation to improve or risk being moved on.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Merson
final_quotes.quote_raw: Marcus Rashford was clearly not the first-choice in attack under Ruud van Nistelrooy. So he has to turn things around under Amorim. If he is unable to do that, I think United have a big problem. Rashford's wages are going to become an issue if they want to move him on. I don't know who buys him at the moment. It will be interesting to see how he performs under Amorim, certainly something to keep an eye on.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Rashford must improve under Amorim or United will face significant challenges, especially regarding his high wages.

final_quotes.speaker: Jamie Carragher
final_quotes.quote_raw: I’ve been really impressed with what the manager has said so far. He certainly has charisma, a personality, he’s laughing and joking with questions. He got asked the question, ‘If I’m a Manchester United fan, what can I see on day one?’ And more often than not a manager would bat that question away and say, ‘Oh, hang on, I’ve only had two training sessions, we’ve got a long way to go, there’s a lot to change.’ But he’s just said straightaway, ‘I can guarantee you that you will see a plan, you’ll see an idea in the first two or three games.' I’m not a Manchester United fan, obviously, but if I’m a Manchester United fan that would fill me with confidence that he was so confident in his abilities, his system.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Amorim's confidence and clear plan for his early games should reassure Manchester United fans.

final_quotes.speaker: Fabrizio Romano
final_quotes.quote_raw: As I told you, there is still no agreement done with any club. Real Madrid remain there. But for Alphonso Davies, there are several possibilities. So let’s see what’s going to happen. On Manchester United, a name I already told you last year, because Manchester United were monitoring this player, and keep monitoring this player.

The attraction for me lies in the club where I can show my best performance, develop and win titles. I have that at Bayern. This is where I have my greatest challenge and goals.

final_quotes.speaker: Erik ten Hag
final_quotes.quote_raw: Dear fans, Let me start by thanking you. Thank you for always being there for the club. Whether it was at a game far away or a tough match at Old Trafford, your support has been unshakeable. The atmosphere at Old Trafford has always been electrifying, thanks to you. I felt it many times. Also in away games, it gave the team and me an incredible feeling to hear the United chants taking over the opponents stadiums, whether the game was in England. Europe or during the summer tours. I always enjoyed meeting Manchester United fans throughout the world. Walking the streets and being able to chat with fans in England, Europe, Asia, Australia, the USA - you inspired me and radiated a strong sense of unity. That's what makes United supporters so special. I want to thank you for giving me this feeling and for your support. I also want to thank the staff in every department of the club for their unwavering support in good times and bad. We won two trophies - achievements that I will cherish for the rest of my life. Of course, my dream was to bring more trophies to the cabinet. Unfortunately, that dream has come to an end. I wish all Manchester United fans nothing but success, trophies and glory. Your support and the warmth I received from everyone at the club helped me feel at home. Thank you for this chapter in my life.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I thank the fans for their unwavering support and share my regrets for not winning more trophies during my time at United.

final_quotes.speaker: Bruno Fernandes
final_quotes.quote_raw: I have played, however, especially last season with coach Ten Hag, deeper. In fact, against Everton, I played No.6 and I still think it was one of the most complete games I've played, at all levels. In terms of passing, game organisation, defence, tactics. I have a little thought in my head that I'm going to end my career further back, because everyone who started there and went to No.10 ended up retreating on the field at the end. It's a position I like, playing deeper, facing the game more. With the ball, it makes my game a lot easier because I have a broader view of the game and it is ideal for what we've talked about with the last pass, which can sometimes come from deeper on the pitch. The game with Everton was the one in which I created the most scoring opportunities, even though I was playing deeper and not playing as a No.10.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I have experience playing deeper, and I envision ending my career in a similar role as it allows me to have a broader view of the game and create opportunities, as I did against Everton.

There is more chance to stay if we are in League One than if we were in the Champions League.

And Ferguson went, ‘I don’t f*****g want him to have it.'

final_quotes.speaker: Marcel Reif
final_quotes.quote_raw: It’s no secret that he will probably move to Liverpool next summer. I would put a few euros on it. As the successor to his great idol Mo Salah. Things couldn’t get any better for him.
final_quotes.quote_summary: It's expected he will likely join Liverpool next summer as Salah's successor.

final_quotes.speaker: Markus Krosche
final_quotes.quote_raw: That [amount] won't be enough. It's often the case with many players who join us that we provide them with an environment where they can continue to develop—fully aware that we would let them go if they develop faster than the club itself. That's an agreement we make with the players.
final_quotes.quote_summary: The quoted amount is insufficient; we help players develop but will let them go if they exceed the club's growth.

final_quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
final_quotes.quote_raw: Manchester United have a new manager, Paul Pogba needs a new club and anything can happen in football
final_quotes.quote_summary: With a new manager at United, Pogba could find a new club since anything is possible in football.

final_quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
final_quotes.quote_raw: Paul is desperate to get back playing and if there was a transfer fee you couldn't see it, but as a free agent it's a different ball game completely.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Pogba is eager to return to play, and being a free agent changes the situation significantly compared to having a transfer fee.

final_quotes.speaker: Wes Brown
final_quotes.quote_raw: There will be money involved but it could be relatively risk-free and he'll be desperate to impress.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Though there will be expenses, signing Pogba could be a low-risk decision, as he will be keen to prove himself.

final_quotes.speaker: Paul Pogba
final_quotes.quote_raw: My time at Juventus has come to an end. It has been a privilege to pull on the shirt of the bianconeri and to share so many special moments together. I cherish the moments we made. They live on
final_quotes.quote_summary: I’ve concluded my time with Juventus, cherishing the special memories we created together.

final_quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
final_quotes.quote_raw: I would say Dele (Alli),
final_quotes.quote_summary: Dele Alli was my toughest opponent in training.

final_quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
final_quotes.quote_raw: My first few camps, when I was younger, and he was at the top of his game at that time.
final_quotes.quote_summary: When I was younger, Dele was at his peak during our training camps.

final_quotes.speaker: Trent Alexander-Arnold
final_quotes.quote_raw: He was untouchable.
final_quotes.quote_summary: He was unbeatable in training.

final_quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
final_quotes.quote_raw: I spoke about it in my interview and don't want to go over it too much again – but I know my level as a player and what I can get to.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I recognize my own level as a player and my potential.

final_quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
final_quotes.quote_raw: It's hard for me to even watch football. It's been tough for me, I'd say, this past eight months has been hard to watch.
final_quotes.quote_summary: It's been difficult for me to follow football due to my situation over the past eight months.

final_quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
final_quotes.quote_raw: You know you can set reminders on your phone, I have a reminder at 11 o'clock every day that says, 'World Cup 2026.' That's my aim for now.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I have a daily reminder for 'World Cup 2026' as my current goal.

final_quotes.speaker: Dele Alli
final_quotes.quote_raw: I think that people will be like, 'he hasn't played in a year,' but I don't care, I know my level.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Despite not playing for a year, I am confident in my abilities.

final_quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: We know that we need time, but we have to win time. To win time is to win games. But the most important thing for me is identity. So since day one we will start with our identity.
final_quotes.quote_summary: We need time to succeed, but we have to win games to create our identity immediately.

final_quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: That’s for sure. That’s why we are Manchester United. That’s why we are … a long time ago, we don’t win the Premier League. But if you ask, Manchester United is the biggest club in England. So this is part of the history, it is not now. So we have to address that, to show that and to try to win again.
final_quotes.quote_summary: Manchester United's history is significant, and we need to acknowledge it while striving to win again.

final_quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: When Manchester United talked to me, Omar, they told me about their plans and you get excited. It’s a real honour because I was the first choice to start that path. So it’s a great responsibility. But you feel honoured and excited to be part of that.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I'm honored to be the first choice and excited about Manchester United's plans.

final_quotes.speaker: Rúben Amorim
final_quotes.quote_raw: It’s hard to explain. It’s strange because it’s a feeling of belonging at the first day. And I know that it’s going to be tough. I know it’s a massive challenge, but I feel quite relaxed. I feel at home and I think that is important in the beginning. So, I’m very excited.
final_quotes.quote_summary: I feel a strong sense of belonging in Manchester despite the challenges ahead; I'm excited and relaxed.

final_quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy
final_quotes.quote_raw: To everyone at Manchester United Football Club, in particular the ­backroom staff, the players and the fans, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your incredible efforts and support. It has been a privilege and honour to ­represent the club as a player, coach and manager, and I will always cherish the memories we have shared together. @ManUtd will always have a special place in my heart, and I hope there are many more glory days at Old Trafford very soon – not only because I want the club to do well, but because you all deserve it!
final_quotes.quote_summary: I’m grateful for the support from everyone at Manchester United; it's been a privilege to be part of the club, and I hope for future success.
